content:
Certainly! Here are some additional study hacks you could try:

1. Use flashcards – This is a great way to help remember important details or concepts, and they're portable so you can study anywhere.

2. Use study apps – There are many study apps available that can help you organize your study material, make reminders, and gamify your study session.

3. Take handwritten notes – Writing notes by hand rather than typing them can help improve memory retention and recall.

4. Study in groups – Studying in a group can help you stay motivated, gain new perspectives, and share knowledge.

5. Use visualization techniques – Visualizing information in a creative and imaginative way, such as making mind maps, can help improve memory and recall.

6. Keep hydrated – Drinking plenty of water while studying can help you stay alert and avoid feeling tired.

7. Stay active – Taking short walks, doing stretches or exercise between study sessions can help you feel refreshed and energized.

8. Listen to music – If music helps you concentrate and focus, listen to low volume and instrumental music while studying.

Remember, everyone has their unique ways of studying, and it is essential to experiment with different strategies and techniques to find what works best for you.
